start-form.title: Oxford HCV Automated Subtyping Tool
start-form.note:
This tool uses phylogenetic methods to identify the subtype of query sequences. The recombination analysis compares your query sequences to a reference alignment of the 6 HCV genotypes.
Note for batch analysis: The Oxford HCV subtype tool accepts up to {1} sequences at a time.

tutorial-text.text:
Multiple sequences can be submitted to the Oxford HCV subtyping tool.
The batch report (figure1) will be the batch report and contain information on the sequence name, length, assigned subtype and a figure of the HCV genome. Accessing the report link will take the user to a report to each submitted sequence.

The sequence report (figure 2) will be composed of three areas named: sequence assignment, analysis details and phylogenetic analyses.
The Sequence assignment contains information on:
the sequence submitted (name and length),
the classification assignment (subtype, subgroup and bootstrap support),
a graphical representation of the HCV genome showing the genomic region of the query sequence with the start and end positions related to the 1A.COLONEL genome,
the motivation of the classification (this is based on the decision tree).
The Phylogenetic analysis section contains:
the phylogenetic tree in PDF and Nexus format,
the log file generated by PAUP (contains info on the model of evolution and its parameters),
the alignment used.

decisionTrees-text.header: Decision Tree for sequences longer than 800 bp
decisionTrees-text.rule: Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800 bps, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70% without recombination in the bootscan.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %, with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %, with no detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70 %, with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan.
decisionTrees-text.header: Decision Tree for sequences shorter than 800 bp
decisionTrees-text.rule: Subtype assigned based on sequence < 800bp, clustering with inside a HCV subtype with bootstrap > 70%.
Subtype assigned based on sequence < 800bp, clustering with outside a HCV subtype with bootstrap > 70%.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence < 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %.

text.b: The subtyping process consists of three steps:

ul.li: The initial step involves construction of a phylogenetic tree using HKY distance method in PAUP* software.The alignment contains the sequence under query and HCV pure subtypes.
In the second step, the sequence under query sequence is divided into small segments and is analysed for recombination using bootscanning using a sliding window of 400 bps moving in steps of 50 bps.
Finally, in the fourth step, the alignment is examined to determine whether it contains sufficient phylogenetic signals for subtype determination using Treepuzzle software.
